Subject: Upgraded AIC to newest version
Description: an employee on our team upgraded our version. Now we don't have the option to manually add people to the resource groups. Need assistance asap. Thank you.
DevOps_Steps_to_Reproduce__c:
1) Log into AIC 12.0.0.1051 with an account that has an Administrator role.
2) Navigate to Home > "Resource Owners"
3) Click on the "Resource Audit" button.
4) Edit Group Membership on the right-hand side.
5) On the "Group Membership Changes" popup, click the "ADD" button.
6) On the "Add Membership Change" popup, type in and "Select [the] Group".
7) Click Next to select the "Change Type".
8) Search at the top to "Add Members" and then click "OK".
9) The former "SET DATE" functionality (and "Expired" column) are no longer present.
10) See the attached screenshots in the 2 folders in SharePoint:
+++++
"SFC_445101_SS_AIC_11.6.0.37_2025_0516"
"AIC_12.0.0.1051_Screenshots"
+++++



+++++
Step 1: Upgrade the Netwrix Enterprise Auditor to version 12.0.0.1051.  
Step 2: Navigate to the Access Information Center within the Resource Audit feature.  
Step 3: Attempt to manually add individuals to resource groups.  
Step 4: Observe that the option to manually add people to resource groups is no longer available.
What_We_Know__c:
1) Back in AIC 11.6.0.37 under Home > "Resource Ownership" (with the correct permissions) there was a "Change Access" button with which one could "Change Resource Access" (Add, Remove, Change resource access).

2) Also in AIC 11.6.0.37, on the "Change Resource Access" popup the end user could "SET [a] DATE" for temporary access that would expire on that date.  This temporary access functionality seems to be missing in AIC 12.0.0.1051.

3) And there was a column on the Home > Access Requests screen called "Expired" which would show the "Access will expire <DATE>" upon mouseover.

4) See the attached screenshots in the 2 folders:
+++++
"SFC_445101_SS_AIC_11.6.0.37_2025_0516"
"AIC_12.0.0.1051_Screenshots"
+++++
Next_Steps__c:
+++++
2025_0520: second meeting with the customer after confirming the old behavior in AIC 11.6.0.37.
+++++

+++++
2025_0515: Must review the meeting
+++++
Solution_Comment__c:
1) Navigate to "Home" > "Configuration" > "Active Directory". 

2) Ensure that the checkbox for "Allow this account to make changes to group membership" is checked and click the "Save" button.
+++++

3) At the "Home Page login" > Click on "RESOURCE OWNER" (big blue box) > click or select a Resource Name > and click the blue "UPDATE" button at the bottom of the screen.

4) On the "Update resource" popup > at the 3rd step = "3. Access Groups" > ensure that you have the boxes checked for:

"Allow access requests"
"Allow owners to change access"
